lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau khY mMjwr krau n Ahwr mws mUsw dyiK pwCY daury DIr n Drq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Kahai Manjaar Karau N Ahaar Maasa , Moosaa Daykhi Paachhai Dauray Dheer N Dharat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a tom cat says that he has stopped eating meat but as soon as he sees a mouse runs after him (cannot control his desire to eat him up).

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kaUAw rIs kY mrwl sBw jwie bYTy Cwif mukqwhl durgMD ismrq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Kaooaa Rees Kai Maraal Sabhaa Jaai Baitthay , Chhaadi Moukataahal Duragandh Simarat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a crow goes and sit among swans but leaving aside pearls which is the food of swans, he always desires to eat filth and dross.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy moin gih isAwr krq Anyk jqn sunq isAwr BwiKAw rihE n prq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Moni Gahi Siaar Karat Anayk Jatana , Sounat Siaar Bhaakhiaa Rahiao N Parat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a jackal may try myriad times to keep quiet but listening to other jackals just by the force of habit, cannot help howling.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy pr qn pr Dn dUK n qiRdoK mn khq kY CwifE cwhY tyv n trq hY ]539]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Par Tan Par Dhan Dookh N Tridokh Mana , Kahat Kai Chhaadiao Chaahai Tayv N Tarat Hai ?539?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the three vices of ogling at other's wife, keeping an eye on other's wealth and slander are inhabiting in my mind like a chronic disease. Even if someone tells me to leave them, this bad habit cannot go away.
